content.question:
A mortgage is a type of loan that can be used to purchase a house. A large bank is interested in the relationship between a customers’ years of experience in their current job and the mortgage amount for customers with a mortgage. They selected 100 customers with a mortgage at random and used the data to test the claim that there is a negative linear relationship between years of experience in the current job and mortgage amount. The following hypotheses were used to test the claim.

<math alttext="H sub 0: beta sub 1 equals 0. H sub a: beta sub 1 is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The test yielded a <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of <math alttext="negative 3.865" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.865</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with a corresponding <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.0001. Which of the following is the correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: If the alternative hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of <math alttext="negative 3.865" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.865</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> or smaller is 0.0001.

If the alternative hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of <math alttext="negative 3.865" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.865</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> or greater is 0.0001.

If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of <math alttext="negative 3.865" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.865</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> or greater is 0.0001.

If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of <math alttext="negative 3.865" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.865</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is 0.0001.

If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of <math alttext="negative 3.865" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.865</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> or smaller is 0.0001.

content.answer: If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of <math alttext="negative 3.865" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.865</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> or smaller is 0.0001.

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
